## Quanteda Objects

Corpus: a dataframe with character strings and variables. Key goal: combine text with document-level variables

Tokens: A list of vectors containing tokens

key: more efficient than strings, but still holds position info

Document-feature matrix (DFM): Matrix holding features frequencies (bag-of-words).

key: most efficient, but no position data![](images/Screen%20Shot%202024-04-16%20at%2011.42.26%20AM.png)

## Create Corpus

Make corpus from:

-   character vector

-   datafram of characters

-   VCorpus of SimpleCorpus object (from tm package)

```{r}
corp_immig <- corpus(data_char_ukimmig2010, 
                     docvars = data.frame(party = names(data_char_ukimmig2010)))
print(corp_immig)
```

```{r}
summary(corp_immig)
```

From dataframe:

```{r}
# set path
path_data <- system.file("extdata/", package = "readtext")

# import csv file
dat_inaug <- read.csv(paste0(path_data, "/csv/inaugCorpus.csv"))
names(dat_inaug)

corp_inaug <- corpus(dat_inaug, text_field = "texts")
print(corp_inaug)
```

```{r}
summary(corp_inaug, 5)
```

Change labels of corpus (under text):

```{r}
docid <- paste(dat_inaug$Year, 
               dat_inaug$FirstName, 
               dat_inaug$President, sep = " ")
docnames(corp_inaug) <- docid
print(corp_inaug)
```

```{r}
summary(corp_inaug, 5)
```

## VCorpus

```{r}
corp_tm <- tm::VCorpus(tm::VectorSource(data_char_ukimmig2010))
corp_quanteda <- corpus(corp_tm)
```

```{r}
summary(corp_tm, 5)
```
